texts.textentryhtml:
Prince de Conti; Paris; in possession, 1777.
Duc de Choiseul; Paris; sold 1787.
LeBrun; Paris; bought 1787.
Welbore Ellis Agar; England; in posession 1802-3; sold 1806.
Earl of Grosvenor; London; bought 1806; in possession 1860.
Duke of Westminster; London; in possession 1864-1924.
A.E. Newton; New York; 1925.
The Art Museum, Princeton University; Princeton; 1935-.

caption: School of Raphael (1483–1520; born Rome, Italy; died Urbino, Italy), Virgin and Child with Saint John (Madonna of the Veil). Oil on wood panel; 132 x 110 cm, 159.5 × 137.5 × 16.5 cm (frame). Gift of Gerard B. Lambert, Class of 1908, in memory of Professor Howard Crosby Butler, in 1925 (y783)
